content: alpine blueberry beanie ♡ ♡ a pattern by clara benadon clarabenadon@gmail com | ravelry @benadon | ig @clara makes stuff this beanie is inspired by western norway where hikers need to set aside time to pick wild blueberries on their fjordside adventures while blueberries there come into season in the mid-summer this cozy hat can keep you toasty through the chilly nordic fall and winter its design plays with texture and pattern by including cabled lattices and traditional fair isle colorwork i knitted the above hat using vidde norwegian lambswool processed and dyed by hillesvåg ullvarefabrikk hillesvåg is a historic family mill located north of bergen i would recommend using local wool to imbue your piece with some place-based flair 1 size & fit loosely fits a medium to large adult head you can easily adjust your hat s size by adding or subtracting pattern repeats materials dk / light worsted weight yarn i recommend using a light base color with good stitch definition so the delicate cablework stands out more yarn gauge 22 stitches x 25 row = 10 x 10 cm in colorwork pattern base color 70g / 140 meters accent color 30g / 60 meters size us 5 / 3 75 mm needles or any size that works well for you j 6 stitch markers 1 for beginning of round / 5 for pattern repeats stitches and abbreviations co = cast on eor = end of round k = knit st / sts = stitch / stitches p = purl k2tog = knit two together k1tbl = knit one through back loop c2r = cross 2 right bor = beginning of round c2l = cross 2 left instructions loosely co 112 or another multiple of 16 brim p1 to join in the round place bor marker *k1tbl p1 * repeat from * to * until eor this pattern is called twisted rib work in twisted rib until brim measures 6 cm / 2 5 in body work 1st round of
